settings.title: New Eczema Gloves with Anti-Sweat Technology
settings.review_text: Discover Drye’s eczema-friendly gloves, designed specifically for sensitive skin and ideal for preventing sweat and irritation. Our breathable, hypoallergenic gloves provide soothing relief for eczema-prone hands, making daily wear comfortable and irritation-free.

settings.title: New Eczema Gloves with Anti-Sweat Technology
settings.review_text: DRYE is the only textile and glove that keeps moisture away from your skin—stopping sweat buildup that triggers irritation and eczema flare-ups. Our breathable, hypoallergenic design ensures all-day comfort for sensitive hands.

settings.title: The Only Gloves to Keep Moisture Off Skin, Preventing Dryness & Eczema
The Only Gloves to Keep Moisture Off Skin, Preventing Dryness & Eczema
settings.content: Our gloves are a unique invention and the only ones on the market that hold moisture away from the skin layer. This makes them especially helpful for use under nitrile/latex gloves and for people with hand-related issues like dry, cracked, and eczema-prone skin. Made in Sweden.

Our gloves are a unique invention and keep moisture away from the skin, regardless of how long you work, train, or sleep. This makes them especially helpful for use under nitrile/latex gloves and for people with hand-related issues like dry, cracked, or eczema-prone skin.

settings.title: Extended glove wear
settings.content: Extended glove use during activities like household chores, working with equipment, or participating in sports often leads to sweaty hands. This moisture can cause discomfort, leading to itching, dryness, and cracked skin.

settings.title: Moisture buildup
settings.content: Continuous exposure to wet conditions can weaken the skin’s natural barrier, leaving it prone to irritation and infection. This breakdown increases the risk of maceration, a condition where the skin becomes overly soft and more susceptible to damage.

settings.title: New solution for common hand issues
settings.content: Research published in the Journal of Dermatology highlights that prolonged moisture exposure can worsen issues like eczema, encouraging bacterial and fungal growth, and often requiring more intensive treatments. DRYE was founded to address the challenges of moisture exposure.

settings.title: New Textile Innovation for Healthier Hands
settings.content: Most gloves absorb sweat—making eczema worse. DRYE’s advanced moisture-wicking fabric moves sweat away from your skin, keeping hands dry and irritation-free. No more damp gloves causing itchiness and flare-ups.

settings.title: Super Thin & Hypoallergenic
settings.content: Made from an ultra-thin, breathable material, DRYE is designed to feel like a second skin. It’s hypoallergenic, lightweight, and durable, lasting 3-12 months—unlike traditional alternatives or that wear out fast.

settings.title: Custom-Fit & Long-Life for cost effeciency
settings.content: Every hand is different, and a poor fit means less protection. DRYE is designed for a customizable fit, ensuring better protection, improved comfort, and enhanced moisture control for all-day wear.

settings.title: Why should I use this Liner?
settings.content: Our glove is a natural replacement for traditional materials like cotton, silk, and bamboo, as it effectively wicks moisture away from the skin. Moisture buildup is a key trigger for conditions like pompholyx, dermatitis, and eczema, leading to dry, itchy, and scaly hands. By using our glove, you can help keep your skin dry and comfortable, reducing the risk of flare-ups. Plus, our gloves are designed for durability and can be washed and reused for 3-12 months, making them a cost-effective and eco-friendly choice.

settings.title: What makes the gloves different?
settings.content:
Unlike traditional alternatives, keeps moisture away and wicks moisture away from the skin layer—regardless of how long you work, train, or sleep. This new textile technology and glove have shown promising results in Sweden for individuals suffering from hand eczema, cracking, redness, and dry skin.

More about research, collaborations, evidence, and before-and-after results can be found under 'News' or 'About Us'.

settings.title: Does this fall under PPE Regulation?
settings.content:
To CE mark a product according to the PPE Regulation, it can only be done if the product meets the requirements for Personal Protective Equipment (PPE), and an inner glove does not qualify as personal protective equipment.

To be considered PPE, the product must protect against external risks to varying degrees, which an inner glove does not do.

This formulation comes from RISE itself.

Contact me here (click) for more information or questions regarding your business and your inquiry.

settings.title: How does it work?
settings.content:
• Work & Home: The glove can be worn under other gloves during work tasks or household chores to help keep hands dry and extend the lifespan of those gloves.
  • Sleep & Training: It can also be worn overnight for moisture control while sleeping or during workouts to maintain comfort.
  • Adventure & Travel: These gloves can be useful for outdoor activities and travel, helping to keep hands dry and comfortable under other gloves.

settings.title: How long does these gloves last?
settings.content: With proper care, the liner is designed to last between 3 to 12 months, although actual durability may vary depending on usage and handling.

settings.title: Why is this liner more expensive than traditional ones?
settings.content: The gloves are priced higher than traditional alternatives because they use advanced anti-sweat technology to keep moisture away from the skin for extended periods. This is important, as moisture can aggravate skin issues like dryness, redness, irritation, and cracks. Traditional liners tend to absorb moisture, leading to wet gloves that can worsen skin conditions. These gloves are washable and reusable, lasting 3 to 12 months.

settings.title: Are these gloves only for people with dry and sensitive hands?
settings.content: No, these gloves are not exclusively for individuals with dry and sensitive hands. They offer sweat and irritation protection for all users and can be comfortably worn under various glove types, including leather, work, surgical, rubber, household, and disposable gloves. This versatility makes them suitable for a wide range of activities and preferences.

settings.title: What are the washing instructions?
settings.content: Machine wash the liner at up to 60 degrees. For a fresh feel, some users prefer to hand wash them every few days to maintain their condition.

settings.title: What kind of material is it?
settings.content: While our patent application is ongoing, we can share that DRYE Liner is made of absorbent and transporting materials, both non-allergenic and gentle on the skin.

settings.title: Can hand eczema go  away?
settings.content: Hand eczema is a chronic condition, but symptoms can be managed and reduced with proper treatment. Careful management, avoiding triggers, and using moisturizers can help control flare-ups and improve skin health.

settings.title: How do you get rid of dyshidrosis?
settings.content: To manage dyshidrosis (pompholyx), keep hands dry, avoid irritants, and use moisturizing creams. Managing stress and avoiding triggers like sweat can also help prevent flare-ups.

settings.title: What does contact dermatitis look like?
settings.content: Contact dermatitis typically appears as red, itchy rashes, which may include blisters, swelling, or dry, scaly patches. The affected area often shows signs of irritation where the skin came into contact with the allergen or irritant.

settings.title: What triggers pompholyx?
settings.content: Pompholyx (dyshidrotic eczema) is often triggered by sweating, stress, allergens, and heat. Irritants like chemicals and metals can also worsen flare-ups. Keeping hands dry helps manage symptoms.
